title: Lioness star slapped with driving fine after  failing to attend court
body_text:
Lioness star slapped with driving fine after 'failing to attend court'
Khiara Keating has been slapped with a fine for failing to pay her car tax
One of the Lionesses has been hit with a driving fine just hours after celebrating England's win with a parade through central London.
Khiara Keating, 21, from Westhoughton was part of the winning squad which took home the trophy at the Euro 2025 final following a nail-biting match against Spain.
The Lionesses' tense match came down to final penalties, with star player Chloe Kelly securing the goal which would make England champions for a third time.
Ms Keating was present for the London celebratory parade on Tuesday, July 29, with the footballer snapped celebrating with crowds.
READ MORE: Cat Deeley and Patrick Kielty full statement after they split
It was reported she failed to appear at court after she was stopped while driving a Volkswagen Polo without the correct tax in December last year.
The goalkeeper was pulled over in Bury, Greater Manchester and was informed her tax had expired four months earlier.
In her absence, Tameside magistrates court decided the star would be charged with a £440 fine by the court, and ordered to pay back duty of £79.17 and £20 costs," the Express said.
It comes after the police dropped a charge against the footballer of possessing nitrous oxide canisters in June, just before the Euros got underway.
After the charges were dropped, Ms Keating told the BBC: “I’m relieved the charges have been dropped. As I’ve always said, I did nothing wrong.
"It’s been a difficult time, but I’ve always known the truth. Now I’m just looking forward to focusing fully on the Euros and spending time with my family.”
Focus on the Euros she did, with Ms Keating making up part of the historic Lionesses side who became the first England senior side to retain a major tournament.
While she didn't play a minute in Switzerland, Ms Keating made up an important part of the squad and was quick to pile the praise on team-mate Michelle Agyemang, following the teenager's heroic equaliser against Italy.
READ MORE: Cat Deeley found UK move 'really hard' before Patrick Kielty break up
Speaking to BBC Radio 5 Live, she said: "Mich is Mich, I think she's such a good person to have in the team. You know what you're going to get hard work goals.
"At such a young age, it's an inspiration to see. Someone my age, a little bit younger, is going out and scoring goals that could've sent us home if she didn't score."
On her character: "Mich always has that underlying confidence, she might not be the loudest one in the group or the one that's walking with her chest held high. But she always knows what she has to do and she's very good at it." Joking, Ms Keating concluded: "I'm the loud one, she's the quiet one."
Ms Keating will now have a period of time away from football before she returns to City training ahead of the new Women's Super League season. The Blues get their campaign underway against reigning champions Chelsea on Friday, September 5.
